sentences.english: But I heard that many pop stars do lip-synch these days.
sentences.chinese: 不过我听说现在有很多流行歌手都假唱。

sentences.english: The amateur singer is reluctant to cheat the audience by lip-synching with a false display of affectation。
sentences.chinese: 这位业余歌手不愿意以虚情假意去假唱糊弄听众。

sentences.english: It sure looks like they are lip-synching this performance… maybe the "lack of Chemistry" comes from that?
sentences.chinese: 很显然他们是在假唱，或许“不来电”是从这儿来的？

sentences.english: Many pop stars lip-sync on the stage nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 现在很多明星在舞台上假唱。

sentences.english: The waiters mime to records playing on the jukebox.
sentences.chinese: 侍者们配合自动唱机里播放的唱片对口型假唱。

sentences.english: Frankly speaking, I would definitely not support super star are lip-synching in Spring Festival Gala.
sentences.chinese: 说实在的，我确实反对明星在春晚的舞台上“假唱”。

sentences.english: The world was appalled by Beijing's singing ring-in.
sentences.chinese: 世界被北京的假唱震惊。

sentences.english: The two singers would be the first case which police intervenes in China.
sentences.chinese: 最近，在四川有这样一个案例，两个歌手被指控假唱。

sentences.english: Are they actually singing up there, or just lip synching?
sentences.chinese: 他们是真的在上面唱歌还是只是假唱？

sentences.english: A lip-synch singer is mostly afraid of being asked to make an improvised performance。
sentences.chinese: 假唱歌手最怕被要求做即兴表演。

sentences.english: Lily: Recently, there is a case in Sichuan which two singers are accused of lip-synching.
sentences.chinese: 最近，在四川有这样一个案例，两个歌手被指控假唱。

sentences.english: Do you think lip-synch should be dealt with seriously?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得应该严肃地对待假唱事件吗？

sentences.english: You cannot sell artificiality to the Europeans and the Americans. They will see through it immediately.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲人和美洲人不会接受假唱，他们一眼就能看出来。

sentences.english: As far as I am concerned, they are strongly against it.
sentences.chinese: 据我所知，她们都很强烈地反对假唱。

sentences.english: The singer's lip-synching is very immoral.
sentences.chinese: 歌手假唱是很不道德的。

sentences.english: Lip-synching has long been common practice in China.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，假唱在中国是常见的做法。

definition: to be off-key or out of tune (while singing) (colloquial)
voicing (adjustment of timbre, loudness etc of organ or other musical instrument)
abbr. for 春節聯歡晚會|春节联欢晚会[Chun1 jie2 Lian2 huan1 Wan3 hui4]
Li Yuchun aka Chris Lee (1984-), Chinese pop singer
The Voice of China, PRC reality talent show
to be a dancing partner to sb/to perform as a backup dancer/taxi dancer (hired dancing partner)/escort
Dolan, a people of the Tarim Basin, Xinjiang, also known as 多郎
